bug.short_desc: [1.8][search]Hierarchy search for lambda expressions do not show all the lambda expressions

long_desc.thetext: Misses the LE I i = () -> 10; in the anonymous class as well
With the patch at https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=425134#c31 I don't see a problem - I didn;t test on HEAD. We know that there are issues with model elements on HEAD.

This works fine on HEAD. Must have gotten fixed along with the recent model changes. Added a regression test here:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?h=BETA_JAVA8&id=723beba465d4cd213bbf2c94b1db0963e06a9745

(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #3) > This works fine on HEAD. Must have gotten fixed along with the recent model > changes. Added a regression test here: > > http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/ > ?h=BETA_JAVA8&id=723beba465d4cd213bbf2c94b1db0963e06a9745
Srikanth: Anonymous entry is shown now. But in the spawned ide, I still find the issue - 10 lambda entries are shown under the hierarchy instead of the actual 6.

(In reply to Manoj Palat from comment #4) > (In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #3) > > This works fine on HEAD. Must have gotten fixed along with the recent model > > changes. Added a regression test here: > > > > http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/ > > ?h=BETA_JAVA8&id=723beba465d4cd213bbf2c94b1db0963e06a9745 > > Srikanth: Anonymous entry is shown now. But in the spawned ide, I still find > the issue - 10 lambda entries are shown under the hierarchy instead of the > actual 6. Please ignore the comment above. verified that there are only 6 after restart; must have got 10 due to some stale entries.
Verified as working for Eclipse + Java 8 RC2 using Kepler SR2 + Eclipse Java Development Tools Patch for Java 8 Support (BETA) 1.0.0.v20140306-1935
